unnormalised: Okay, folks, let's talk traffic! Ever felt like you're playing a real-life Temple Run dodging autos and buses on the streets of Mumbai? Yeah, me too. That's why understanding traffic regulations is super important, not just to avoid a hefty Rs. 5000 challan, but also to, you know, stay alive!
normalised: Okay, folks, let's talk traffic! Ever felt like you're playing a real-life Temple Run dodging autos and buses on the streets of Mumbai? Yeah, me too. That's why understanding traffic regulations is super important, not just to avoid a hefty rupee five thousand challan, but also to, you know, stay alive!

unnormalised: First off, signals! Red means stop – I know, captain obvious, but you'd be surprised. Yellow means prepare to stop, not speed up to beat the light like you’re auditioning for a Fast & Furious movie in Delhi. Green means go, but always double-check for stray cows or rickshaws pulling a fast one.

unnormalised: Speed limits are another biggie. In most cities, it’s around 40-50 kmph, but on highways like the Delhi-Jaipur expressway, you can usually push it to 80-100 kmph. Pay attention to the signs; ignorance is no excuse, especially when there are cameras everywhere, ready to catch you breaking the rules. Plus, excessive speeding can lead to accidents. Remember that chap from IIT Kanpur who totalled his car last year? Not fun.

unnormalised: Lane discipline! This is where things get truly chaotic. Stick to your lane, folks. Left for overtaking, middle for cruising, and right for… well, dodging potholes the size of small apartments (approx. 200 sq ft, maybe?). And use your indicators! It's not just for show; it actually tells other drivers what you're planning.

unnormalised: Also, helmets for two-wheeler riders! No excuses. Dr. Sharma at the AIIMS trauma center will thank you (and so will your head). It's the law, and it could save your life. And don't even think about drinking and driving, especially during festive times like Diwali. The cops are out in force, and jail isn’t exactly a fun place to spend your holidays. Stay safe, drive smart, and let's make Indian roads a little less stressful, okay? Jai Hind!
